document_data.name: That Which Guards
document_data.mainbody:
'''That Which Guards''' was a [[death knight]] sentry that guarded the entrance to the [[Murder Tribunal]] deep in the [[Undercellar]] of [[Baldur's Gate|Baldur's Gate's]] [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{Quote|''Present me well from gifts thine own,''
''Or I shall rend thy flesh from bone.''''|That Which Guards}}
document_data.Description: That Which Guards wore a set of intricately decorated powerful ''[[Blackguard's plate]]'', [[plate mail]] [[gauntlets]], plate [[boot]]s, and a horsetail [[helmet]]. The creature's armor was lines with [[gold]]. It carried [[enchanted]] ''[[Blackguard's sword]]'' and a large ''[[shield of the undevout]]''.
document_data.Abilities: That Which Guards shared abilities and vulnerabilities of other [[undead]] creatures. It could ''marshal undead'', protecting itself and nearby undead from being turned. It also could cast the ''[[hellfire orb]]'' [[spell]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, That Which Guards was placed to stand guard of the entrance to the Murder Tribunal alongside [[That Which Lurks (death knight)|That Which Lurks]] and [[That Which Watches]]. The creature spoke in rhymes with an archaic turn of phrase.
